definitions.definition: In or to a lower or subordinate position, or a position beneath or below something, physically or figuratively.
So as to pass beneath something.
Less than what is necessary to be adequate or suitable ; insufficient .
In or into an unconscious state.
examples: It took the hypnotist several minutes to make his subject go under .

definitions.definition: Down to defeat, ruin, or death.
examples: The COVID-19 epidemic and shutdown took some businesses under .
Big-box store and online retailing have driven many specialty and local retail stores under .

main_definition: In or to a lower or subordinate position, or a position beneath or below something, physically or figuratively.
secondary_definitions: So as to pass beneath something.
( usually in compounds ) Less than what is necessary to be adequate or suitable ; insufficient .
( informal ) In or into an unconscious state.
Down to defeat, ruin, or death.
